channel.title: Minecraft, Greenscreen, and photoshop
channel.description:
I was zooming around on youtube and found a video of someone (in minecraft) but walking around on a IRL picture of a beach, I decided to see how greenscreen worked inside of minecraft. This is what I found.
1> Replace glowstone texture with a solid bright color (i highly suggest green: 0x0ae800) [img]http://i.imgur.com/75Dvm.png[/img]
2> Build a basic box out of glowstone (probably best to be in creative mode for this) and stand in it.
3> Take a screenshot (f2) or setup a basic MC server really fast to take a picture of yourself on another account. http://i.imgur.com/H8OCt.png
4> Load the image into photoshop and crop out the green. NOTE: This may still leave a very small amount of green around your character, nothing hard to fix. To create a small 'antialias' around the edges I created a mask limited to the character, then used a Gaussian blur (2.0 pixels) on the mask.
5> Add layers and designs to make yourself a wallpaper. http://i.imgur.com/KKpXU.jpg
Edited texture pack download for greenscreen: http://up.ht/yhUUwD

item.title: Minecraft, Greenscreen, and photoshop
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:2, topic:430589”]since minecraft characters are so blocky, it would be easier to just make a render of your character and lay it on top of a background

if youll notice, you can still see green around your character[/quote] it can be easily fixed. I was going for a quick patch for the sake of the tutorial. I can do a much better picture if I wanted to.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft, Greenscreen, and photoshop
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I was zooming around on youtube and found a video of someone (in minecraft) but walking around on a IRL picture of a beach, I decided to see how greenscreen worked inside of minecraft. This is what I found.

1> Replace glowstone texture with a solid bright color (i highly suggest green: 0x0ae800)

2> Build a basic box out of glowstone (probably best to be in creative mode for this) and stand in it.

3> Take a screenshot (f2) or setup a basic MC server really fast to take a picture of yourself on another account.

4> Load the image into photoshop and crop out the green.
NOTE: This may still leave a very small amount of green around your character, nothing hard to fix. To create a small ‘antialias’ around the edges I created a mask limited to the character, then used a Gaussian blur (2.0 pixels) on the mask.

5> Add layers and designs to make yourself a wallpaper.

Edited texture pack download for greenscreen:
http://up.ht/yhUUwD
